title: Loe of Maui
text:
Loe (<a href="Hawaiian%20language">Hawaiian</a>: "Loe o Maui") was a <a href="Tribal%20chief">High Chief</a> in <a href="ancient%20Hawaii">ancient Hawaii</a> and he ruled as the 9th known <a href="Alii%20nui%20of%20Maui">King of Maui</a> ("Moʻi"). He was the sovereign <a href="king">king</a> or chief of the island of <a href="Maui">Maui</a>, mentioned in old chants, and ancestor of <a href="Kalahumoku%20II">Kalahumoku II</a>.
Life.
Loe was a son of the Chief <a href="Kamaloohua">Kamaloohua</a> by his consort, Kapu of Maui, and thus a grandson of <a href="Kuhimana">Kuhimana</a>. He followed his father as chief of Maui.
Although war did not occur between Maui and any of the <a href="Hawaii">other islands</a> during his reign, there was a disturbance in his father's reign.
He married a woman named <a href="Waha%CA%BBakuna">Wahaʻakuna</a>, who is mentioned by <a href="Samuel%20Kamakau">Samuel Kamakau</a>. She bore him a son named <a href="Kahokuohua">Kahokuohua</a>, who was a <a href="Ali%CA%BBi">King</a> of <a href="Molokai">Molokai island</a>.
Loe is considered to be the great progenitor of the <a href="Ali%CA%BBi">Maui chiefdom</a>. His successor was his grandson, <a href="Kaulahea%20I">Kaulahea I</a>.
